checks.detail: log10(S_H)≈14.1 > 0 (entropy per Hubble volume at reheating)

gaps: A publication-grade ToE arrow requires a microscopic, non-invertible mechanism (e.g. torsion flux / seam transitions) and a falsifiable observable; this module provides the minimal entropy-production proxy baseline.
inputs: cosmology history policy: tfpt_suite/data/k_calibration.json (reheating snapshot: T_reh, g_*)
spec.name: Arrow mechanism (entropy production proxy from reheating; explicit, auditable baseline)
objective: Close the arrow-of-time placeholder with a concrete entropy-production proxy tied to explicit cosmology inputs.
Keep scope explicit: this is a baseline (reheating entropy), not a microscopic proof of irreversibility.
outputs: entropy production proxy S_H ≡ s/H^3 at reheating (dimensionless; per Hubble volume)
log10(S_H) as a robust arrow-of-time marker
spec.question: Is there a concrete, testable arrow-of-time mechanism implemented (beyond a placeholder)?
validation: Computes a deterministic entropy-production proxy from the declared reheating snapshot (no hidden fit parameters).
